ArticleTitle.sentence: The B cell-specific nuclear factor OTF-2 positively regulates transcription of the human class II transplantation gene, DRA.

event.clue: The B cell-specific nuclear factor OTF-2 positively regulates transcription of the human class II transplantation gene, DRA.
The B cell-specific nuclear factor OTF-2 positively regulates transcription of the human class II transplantation gene, DRA.

AbstractText.sentence: The promoter of the major histocompatibility class II gene DRA contains an octamer element (ATTTGCAT) that is required for efficient DRA expression in B cells.

event.clue: The promoter of the major histocompatibility class II gene DRA contains an octamer element (ATTTGCAT) that is required for efficient DRA expression in B cells.
The promoter of the major histocompatibility class II gene DRA contains an octamer element (ATTTGCAT) that is required for efficient DRA expression in B cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Several DNA-binding proteins are known to bind this sequence.

event.clue: Several DNA-binding proteins are known to bind this sequence.

AbstractText.sentence: The best characterized are the B cell-specific OTF-2 and the ubiquitous OTF-1.
This report directly demonstrates that OTF-2 but not OTF-1 regulates the DRA gene.

event.clue: This report directly demonstrates that OTF-2 but not OTF-1 regulates the DRA gene.
This report directly demonstrates that OTF-2 but not OTF-1 regulates the DRA gene.

AbstractText.sentence: In vitro transcription analysis using protein fractions enriched for the octamer-binding protein OTF-2 demonstrate a positive functional role for OTF-2 in DRA gene transcription.

event.clue: In vitro transcription analysis using protein fractions enriched for the octamer-binding protein OTF-2 demonstrate a positive functional role for OTF-2 in DRA gene transcription.
In vitro transcription analysis using protein fractions enriched for the octamer-binding protein OTF-2 demonstrate a positive functional role for OTF-2 in DRA gene transcription.

AbstractText.sentence: In contrast, OTF-1-enriched protein fractions did not affect DRA gene transcription although it functionally enhanced the transcription of another gene.

event.clue: In contrast, OTF-1-enriched protein fractions did not affect DRA gene transcription although it functionally enhanced the transcription of another gene.
In contrast, OTF-1-enriched protein fractions did not affect DRA gene transcription although it functionally enhanced the transcription of another gene.

AbstractText.sentence: Recombinant OTF-2 protein produced by in vitro transcription/translation could also enhance DRA gene transcription in vitro.

event.clue: Recombinant OTF-2 protein produced by in vitro transcription/translation could also enhance DRA gene transcription in vitro.
Recombinant OTF-2 protein produced by in vitro transcription/translation could also enhance DRA gene transcription in vitro.
Recombinant OTF-2 protein produced by in vitro transcription/translation could also enhance DRA gene transcription in vitro.
Recombinant OTF-2 protein produced by in vitro transcription/translation could also enhance DRA gene transcription in vitro.

AbstractText.sentence: In vivo transient transfection studies utilizing an OTF-2 expression vector resulted in similar findings: that OTF-2 protein enhanced DRA gene transcription, and that this effect requires an intact octamer element.

event.clue: In vivo transient transfection studies utilizing an OTF-2 expression vector resulted in similar findings: that OTF-2 protein enhanced DRA gene transcription, and that this effect requires an intact octamer element.

In vivo transient transfection studies utilizing an OTF-2 expression vector resulted in similar findings: that OTF-2 protein enhanced DRA gene transcription, and that this effect requires an intact octamer element.

AbstractText.sentence: Together these results constitute the first direct evidence of a positive role for the lymphoid-specific octamer-binding factor in DRA gene transcription.

event.clue: Together these results constitute the first direct evidence of a positive role for the lymphoid-specific octamer-binding factor in DRA gene transcription.
Together these results constitute the first direct evidence of a positive role for the lymphoid-specific octamer-binding factor in DRA gene transcription.
